class.name: StatPool
class.description:
Component for tracking any numeric stat pool, for example: health, stamina, hunger, etc, where you have current, maximum and minimum values. Handles value modifications, boundary management, and emits various signals for value changes.
Check the [url=https://github.com/shoyguer/stat-pool][b]Official Repository[/b][/url] for more information.

method.name: decrease
method.description: Decreases [value] by the specified amount in [param amount].

method.name: deplete
method.description: Completely depletes [value], setting its value to equal [member min_value].

method.name: fill
method.description: Completely fills [member value], setting its value to equal [member max_value].

method.name: get_percentage
method.description: Returns the current [member value] as a percentage (0.0 to 1.0) relative to the range between [member min_value] and [member max_value].

method.name: increase
method.description: Increases [member value] by the specified amount in [param amount].

method.name: is_depleted
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if [member value] is at [member min_value].

method.name: is_filled
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if [member value] is at [member max_value].

members.member: Maximum possible stat value. If it ever goes below or equal [member min_value], then [member min_value] will be automatically adjusted to exactly 1 integer below [member max_value]. [b]Example:[/b] If [member min_value] is 0 and you set [member max_value] to 0, then [member min_value] will be adjusted to -1.

Minimum possible stat value. If it ever goes above or equal [member max_value], then [member max_value] will be automatically adjusted to exactly 1 integer above [member min_value]. [b]Example:[/b] If [member max_value] is 100 and you set [member min_value] to 100, then [member max_value] will be adjusted to 101.
Current stat value. Automatically clamped between [member min_value] and [member max_value] when set.

signal.name: depleted
signal.description: Signal emitted when [member value] reaches [member min_value].

signal.name: max_value_changed
signal.description: Signal emitted when [member max_value] changes. [param old_max] - Represents the previous maximum value before the change. [param new_max] - Represents the new maximum value after the change. [param increased] - Indicates whether the maximum value was increased ([code]true[/code]) or decreased ([code]false[/code]).

signal.name: min_value_changed
signal.description: Signal emitted when [member min_value] changes. [param old_min] - Represents the previous minimum value before the change. [param new_min] - Represents the new minimum value after the change. [param increased] - Indicates whether the minimum value was increased ([code]true[/code]) or decreased ([code]false[/code]).

signal.name: restored
signal.description: Signal emitted when [member value] changes from [member min_value] to any higher value.

signal.name: restored_fully
signal.description: Signal emitted when [member value] reaches its maximum value [member max_value].

signal.name: value_changed
signal.description: Signal emitted when [member value] changes. [param old_value] - Represents the previous value before the change. [param new_value] - Represents the new value after the change. [param increased] - Indicates whether the value was increased ([code]true[/code]) or decreased ([code]false[/code]).
